jobs.title: Director of Analytics (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

Our Director of Analytics will be an analytical engine behind data-driven decision-making at Rula. You will partner with teammates across the company, including, Data Engineering, Finance, Partnerships, Customer Support, and Clinical Operations, to take ownership of generating insights and recommendations that shape strategy for various teams using data. As a leader of a small team of data scientists, you will draw from your vast analytics toolkit to translate broad questions into actionable research and discovery plans, perform proactive data exploration to identify actionable insights, and communicate results in a compelling manner, often interacting with senior leadership.

Required Qualifications

  • 10+ years of related professional experience; 5+ years of experience aligned to data analytics or data science

  • A Bachelor’s (or higher) degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, or related technical field with strong quantitative foundation

  • Demonstrated people management expertise and talent development, with an emphasis on building and leading high performing analytical teams from large organizations

  • Advanced technical proficiency with modern data stacks (i.e. dbt, Airflow, etc.) and data visualization tools (i.e. Looker, Tableau, Hex, etc.)

  • Strong experience working directly on A/B testing, including experiment design, deployment, dashboarding, results interpretation, and goal setting

  • A proven ability to connect analytics insights to business strategy, influencing decisions that drive revenue and growth

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Experience within a fast-paced, marketplace-focused, high-growth startup environment with the ability to handle dynamic analytical priorities

  • Experience working in large, management consulting environments

  • Expertise in healthcare/health-tech industry

  • Proficiency with Python/R for analytics/scripting

  • Experience building processes end-to-end around data standardization, goaling and reporting

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Core Services (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re looking for a Senior Engineer to join Rula’s Infrastructure Core Services team—the team that builds the backbone of our mental health platform. In this role, you’ll take ownership of critical services that keep our systems secure, scalable, and lightning-fast, including authentication, authorization, event-driven architecture (Kafka), and other core components that every Rula engineer relies on.

If you’re the kind of engineer who loves enabling others to move faster and smarter, this is the team for you! Your work will empower our product teams to ship with confidence by building and delivering high-quality internal tools, SDKs, and shared services that are intuitive, reliable, and widely adopted across the org.

If you thrive on writing clean, tested, and thoughtfully designed code, and take pride in building infrastructure that quietly but powerfully supports everything above it, we’d love to have you shape the future of Rula’s engineering foundation

Required Qualifications

  • Experience building high-quality, user-friendly internal tools, SDKs, and/or engineering empowerment services tools, frequently used across an engineering org.

  • A working knowledge of Kafka-based tools and/or an event-based architecture to ensure the current core Kafka library and CLI tools maintain and evolve.

  • Experience building thorough, well-designed, and tested code, with a high level of personal quality control that leverages standard design concepts and patterns.

  • Experience leading projects without supervision and collaborating within the team and cross-functionally across the org.

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Experience with authentication/authorization integration and usage (OAuth, OIDC, PKCE, etc).

  • Experience working in healthcare, credit card, etc industries where data privacy and security and system stability are a base-line requirement.

  • Experience with Node, Typescript, Ruby, Python, or propensity to quickly learn new languages.

  • Experience working within AWS tools.

  • Experience working in Kubernetes.

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Healthcare Partnerships Associate (Remote - Colorado)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We are seeking a Healthcare Partnerships Associate who thrives in ambiguity and draws energy from building relationships and helping healthcare providers improve the outcomes of their patients. This person will be responsible for the full sales cycle including prospecting, outreaching, consulting, and closing providers within the SMB market. You will align the goals of Primary Care Providers with outcomes that drive business growth for Rula. You will be a high velocity sales professional getting commitments and subsequent referrals from multiple providers each week. Your role will be crucial in expanding our footprint, ensuring we succeed in our mission to make mental healthcare work for everyone. This role is currently 80% remote, with monthly travel required for team co-working. 100% of customer meetings are currently done remotely, but there is potential for a mix of in-person sales in the future. Candidates must be based in the Colorado market.

1 in 5 people are suffering from a mental health issue, and fewer than 50% of people are getting help. We need professionals with a track record of overachievement in outbound healthcare sales or business development that are committed to solving this problem with us and hungry to face the hardships of a 0 to 1 environment. You will join a fast-growing team that has already grown 10x this past year, at the ground level. You’ll be given the opportunity to make an impact on issues that matter in the world while improving your entrepreneurial skills.

Required Qualifications

  • 2+ years carrying a quota in outbound sales, account management, or business development serving the healthcare industry, with a track record of top 25% performance

  • 1+ years self-sourcing at least 50% of deals through outbound channels, including cold calling

  • Experience exceeding annual quotas >75% of career

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Experience managing customer relationships and deals in a CRM tool

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Proficiency applying curiosity and experimentation to solve ambiguous problems

  • Experience selling to a variety of personas in healthcare or health systems, from individual contributor users to executive decision makers

  • Ability to build and scale repeatable processes for driving growth

  • Experience selling at a startup and taking a business from 0 to 1

  • Been promoted internally in previous sales role(s)

  • While we are a fully remote company, we are only considering candidates who reside in Colorado

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Sr. Application Security Engineer (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

The Security Team at Rula is responsible for ensuring the protection of patient data and all of the technology behind our platform. We maintain close partnerships with Engineering and Product teams, but interface with everyone across the company to ensure that security is a core component of Rula’s culture. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to enhance the security of our code and development practices, and enhance our vulnerability management program with Engineering and external partners. Overall, you’ll encounter endless learning opportunities and pursue projects that will leverage and refine your skills. More importantly, the work you do will help ensure the best outcomes for patients as we strive to make mental healthcare work for everyone.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in a security engineering or related role

  • 3+ years of experience in an application security engineering role

  • Experience with TypeScript, JavaScript, and/or Node.js

  • Experience with OWASP Top 10 and the application of those to modern systems

  • Proven success with common SAST and DAST tooling and best practices

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience reviewing and triaging externally reported security vulnerabilities (e.g. bug bounty)

  • A functional understanding of HIPAA requirements and how they apply to application security practices

  • Experience with leading threat modeling exercises to identify security risks in technical designs

  • Familiarity with JS front-end libraries, preferably React

  • Experience interfacing with 3rd party pentesters to validate findings and develop remediation plans

  • Experience reviewing and triaging externally reported security vulnerabilities (e.g. bug bounty)

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

Rula’s mission is to expand access to compassionate, expert mental healthcare. This role exists to make our frontline—and our customers—unmistakably successful. You’ll own the end‑to‑end performance system: Customer experience agent new‑hire onboarding, ongoing upskilling, and the knowledge engine (including the content that powers our AI bots) across multiple audiences and 12+ lines of business.

This is not a “build minimum viable training” job. It’s a design, operate, and scale function that reduces time‑to‑proficiency, lifts quality, and increases self‑service capabilities.

The right candidate for this role knows how to consistently develop agents from zero to highly professional expert problem-solvers within a few months. They will be self-sufficient analytically, braiding together insights from data sources such as quality assurance, agent feedback, and training measurement to feed a continuous feedback loop to drive operational excellence with limited oversight. Successful candidates will have either built this function to scale before in a startup environment and/or in a large company (>$100m ARR) known for world-class, high touch support.

Required Qualifications

  • 10+ years of learning and development experience, with 5+ years specifically in a customer experience/customer support environment

  • 5+ years of experience leading managers of managers, including global teams across onshore, nearshore, and offshore agent environments

  • A proven track record of building agent teams with a reputation for quality working with a complex product

  • Strong understanding of leading-edge adult learning methodologies (e.g., coaching + guided practice, retrieval with spacing)

  • Detailed expertise designing and driving measurable impact metrics (e.g. CSAT, NPS) for training, enablement, and content programs

  • Proficiency with CX enablement tools and technologies (e.g., KMS, LMS)

  • Strong data literacy, leveraging analytics and reporting tools (Excel, Google Sheets, BI Tools) to identify opportunities for improvement

  • Exceptional program, change management, and stakeholder management skills

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Experience building/running a Knowledge-Centered Service (KCS) agent environment

  • Expertise working in scaled and high-growth startup environments

  • Experience with omnichannel customer experience teams (phone, email, and chat)

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Staff AI Engineer (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

As an AI Engineer at Rula, you will play a critical role in shaping the future of AI-assisted therapy by designing, deploying, and scaling generative AI solutions that directly impact patient care. This role is highly cross-functional—you’ll collaborate closely with teams across Product, Data Engineering,, and Application Engineering, to integrate cutting-edge AI into our platform in ways that are ethical, reliable, and impactful.

In this role, you will own the full lifecycle of GenAI solutions: from prototyping and building scalable data pipelines, to developing and testing and ensuring the solutions meet Rula’s high quality standard, to deploying production-ready GenAI solutions and monitoring their performance. Success in this role means balancing innovation with operational excellence—experimenting with new approaches while ensuring deployed solutions are robust, cost-effective, and compliant with privacy and regulatory standards in mental health.

Initially, you’ll jump into the role building early prototypes that work towards delivering AI features into production. Over time, you’ll expand the impact of AI across the organization by creating reusable frameworks, optimizing performance, and identifying new opportunities to enhance both our platform and patient outcomes.

This is an opportunity to lead the way in bringing next-generation AI capabilities to mental health care—transforming therapy experiences for providers and patients alike.

Required Qualifications

  • 8+ years in software engineering, data engineering, or platform engineering/infra

  • 5+ years of experience with Python

  • 7+ Experience with Public Cloud (AWS, GCP, etc.)

  • 5+ years of experience deploying and managing software configuration, build, and deployment processes (CI/CD pipelines) and associated tools

  • 1+ years of experience with building production-ready, AI-powered products at scale to include hands-on experience with foundational AI models (OpenAI, Anthropic, AWS Bedrock), orchestration and safety frameworks (Langchain, Llamaindex), and vector databases (Pinecone, MongoDB, Milvus)

  • Experience collaborating with Data Engineering teams to build scalable data pipelines

  • Strong and effective communicator

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Familiarity with Typescript

  • Experience working in Healthcare or other regulated environments

  • Familiarity with even-driven architectures

  • Experience contributing to early-stage team growth (0 → 1)

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Healthcare Partnerships Associate (Remote - Georgia)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We are seeking a Healthcare Partnerships Associate who thrives in ambiguity and draws energy from building relationships and helping healthcare providers improve the outcomes of their patients. This person will be responsible for the full sales cycle including prospecting, outreaching, consulting, and closing providers within the SMB market. You will align the goals of Primary Care Providers with outcomes that drive business growth for Rula. You will be a high velocity sales professional getting commitments and subsequent referrals from multiple providers each week. Your role will be crucial in expanding our footprint, ensuring we succeed in our mission to make mental healthcare work for everyone. This role is currently 80% remote, with monthly travel required for team co-working. 100% of customer meetings are currently done remotely, but there is potential for a mix of in-person sales in the future. Candidates must be based in the Georgia market.

1 in 5 people are suffering from a mental health issue, and fewer than 50% of people are getting help. We need professionals with a track record of overachievement in outbound healthcare sales or business development that are committed to solving this problem with us and hungry to face the hardships of a 0 to 1 environment. You will join a fast-growing team that has already grown 10x this past year, at the ground level. You’ll be given the opportunity to make an impact on issues that matter in the world while improving your entrepreneurial skills.

Required Qualifications

  • 2+ years carrying a quota in outbound sales, account management, or business development serving the healthcare industry, with a track record of top 25% performance

  • 1+ years self-sourcing at least 50% of deals through outbound channels, including cold calling

  • Experience exceeding annual quotas >75% of career

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Experience managing customer relationships and deals in a CRM tool

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Proficiency applying curiosity and experimentation to solve ambiguous problems

  • Experience selling to a variety of personas in healthcare or health systems, from individual contributor users to executive decision makers

  • Ability to build and scale repeatable processes for driving growth

  • Experience selling at a startup and taking a business from 0 to 1

  • Been promoted internally in previous sales role(s)

  • While we are a fully remote company, we are only considering candidates who reside in Georgia

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Staff Conversational Designer (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re shaping the future of mental health care with AI-enabled experiences that enhance, not replace, the human connection at the core of therapy. Our north star is clinically-grounded and responsible AI designed to bring greater transparency, personalization, and continuous support across the therapy journey. Our work transforms therapy into an experience that’s more connected and accessible. As we expand our portfolio of AI experiences, we’re scaling our team to drive innovation and set a new standard for mental health care.

We are seeking a Conversational Designer to establish the foundation for AI-powered patient experiences at Rula. This is a greenfield opportunity to define how conversational AI can transform the way patients access care. In this role, you will focus on building design frameworks, reviewing model outputs, honing prompts, and ensuring the ways inputs are defined get us the conversational outputs we need. You’ll collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and clinical experts to design natural interactions that balance trust, accessibility, and efficiency.

If you are excited by the challenge of shaping a practice from the ground up and having a lasting impact on how patients engage with care, this role is for you.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in conversation design, UX writing, or related roles in AI-driven and/or ML-driven (pre-AI age) products.

  • Proven ability to design and test conversational flows for chatbots, virtual assistants, or other AI products.

  • Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams (product, engineering, clinical)

  • Strong portfolio demonstrating clear problem-solving through conversational interfaces

  • Beyond excellent written and verbal communication skills, with sensitivity to tone, clarity, and inclusivity.

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Experience designing interfaces for high-trust domains

  • Knowledge of LLMs, natural language understanding, and emerging AI technologies

  • Familiarity with usability testing, A/B testing, or analytics for conversational flows

  • Background in linguistics, psychology, or behavioral design

  • Prior experience in a high-growth start-up environment

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

 - Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams (product, engineering, clinical)

 - Strong portfolio demonstrating clear problem-solving through conversational interfaces

 - Beyond excellent written and verbal communication skills, with sensitivity to tone, clarity, and inclusivity.

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

 - Experience designing interfaces for high-trust domains

 - Knowledge of LLMs, natural language understanding, and emerging AI technologies

 - Familiarity with usability testing, A/B testing, or analytics for conversational flows

 - Background in linguistics, psychology, or behavioral design

 - Prior experience in a high-growth start-up environment

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

 - 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

 - Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

 - Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

 - 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

 - Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

 - Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

 - Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

 - New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer - Backend/AI (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re shaping the future of mental health care with AI-enabled experiences that enhance, not replace, the human connection at the core of therapy. Our north star is clinically-grounded and responsible AI designed to bring greater transparency, personalization, and continuous support across the therapy journey. Our work transforms therapy into an experience that’s more connected and accessible. As we expand our portfolio of AI experiences, we’re scaling our team to drive innovation and set a new standard for mental health care.

We’re hiring a Staff Engineer to provide technical leadership as we build the backend for Rula’s next generation of projects. You’ll set direction for how we design and scale services in TypeScript and Node.js, guiding complex technical initiatives that power mobile and patient-facing experiences. A key focus of this role is enabling AI-powered features that deliver more personalized, effective care at scale. You’ll partner with leaders across engineering and product, mentor senior engineers, and create frameworks that multiply the impact of the org. This is a unique opportunity to shape how technology and AI come together to transform access to mental health care.

Required Qualifications

  • 8-10 years of backend software engineering experience, including designing, building, and operating production systems at scale

  • Experience with at least one backend language commonly used for mobile backends (e.g., Python, Node.js, Ruby).

  • Proven experience designing and implementing APIs (REST and/or GraphQL) to support complex mobile applications

  • Hands-on experience with prompt engineering — designing, testing, and refining prompts to improve model outputs and system performance.

  • Hands-on experience integrating and deploying large language models (via OpenAI, Anthropic, Amazon Bedrock, or custom-hosted models)

  • Strong knowledge of distributed systems fundamentals (scalability, caching, performance optimization, reliability, observability)

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.

  • Familiarity with data-intensive systems or workflows (pipelines, integrations, metrics capture).

  • Experience with modern infrastructure and tooling (CI/CD, cloud platforms, observability).

  • Comfortable participating in on-call rotations, troubleshooting production issues, and contributing to team reliability practices.

  • Prior experience in a high-growth or evolving environment, with ability to adapt to shifting priorities.

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Sr. Product Manager - AI (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re shaping the future of mental health care with AI-enabled experiences that enhance, not replace, the human connection at the core of therapy. Our north star is clinically-grounded and responsible AI designed to bring greater transparency, personalization, and continuous support across the therapy journey. Our work transforms therapy into an experience that’s more connected and accessible. As we expand our portfolio of AI experiences, we’re scaling our team to drive innovation and set a new standard for mental health care.

We’re hiring a Senior Product Manager – AI to launch and scale AI-powered features that transform the patient experience at Rula. This role will explore how AI can support patients before, during, and after care, always in partnership with their human therapist, so patients feel more engaged, supported, and empowered in their therapy journey.

You’ll work at the intersection of AI, clinical expertise, and product innovation, partnering with clinicians, engineers, data scientists, and designers to prototype and test new patient-facing features. Your focus will be on building safe, supportive, and personalized AI experiences that enhance care while maintaining the highest clinical standards. This is a unique opportunity to define how cutting-edge technology can responsibly improve mental health access and outcomes.


Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of product management experience, including 2+ years building user-facing AI features.

  • Strong execution and delivery skills, with proven ability to scope MVPs, align stakeholders, and ship quality products in 0 to 1 environments.

  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate clinical and technical concepts into actionable product frameworks.

  • Experience facilitating highly cross-functional teams (data science, ML engineering, clinical experts, design, and engineering).

  • Demonstrated ability to make tradeoffs and clear decisions in ambiguous, high-stakes environments.


Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Hands-on experience with AI/ML prototyping or tools (e.g., prompting, RAG, evaluations).

  • Demonstrated ability to set a holistic product vision while executing iteratively.

  • Familiarity with building and evaluating AI quality metrics and incorporating them into product decisions.

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Sr. Product Manager - Mobile AI (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re shaping the future of mental health care with AI-enabled experiences that enhance, not replace, the human connection at the core of therapy. Our north star is clinically-grounded and responsible AI designed to bring greater transparency, personalization, and continuous support across the therapy journey. Our work transforms therapy into an experience that’s more connected and accessible. As we expand our portfolio of AI experiences, we’re scaling our team to drive innovation and set a new standard for mental health care.

We’re hiring a Senior Product Manager – Mobile (AI) to lead the launch of Rula’s first patient-facing mobile app, creating a seamless and supportive way for patients to engage with therapy. This is a rare 0 to 1 opportunity where you’ll own the end-to-end product vision, from ensuring feature parity with web to introducing new AI-assisted mobile experiences that transform the patient journey.

You’ll collaborate closely with engineering, design, and executive leadership to establish the foundations of our mobile platform, including architecture, release practices, and design systems that scale. Beyond the initial launch, you’ll shape how cross-platform development becomes a core competency at Rula, ensuring that patients have a unified experience across web, mobile, and beyond. If you’re passionate about building mobile products that improve lives and are excited by the intersection of healthcare and AI, this role is for you.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of product management experience, including 2+ years owning mobile app development (0 to 1 experience preferred).

  • Proven track record of launching consumer-facing apps with meaningful adoption.

  • Strong execution and delivery skills, including defining MVPs, aligning stakeholders, and shipping products in ambiguous 0 to 1 environments.

  • Fluency in mobile-specific considerations such as framework tradeoffs, release cadence, notifications, and app store practices.

  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence both executive leadership and cross-functional peers.

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Experience building AI-enabled consumer products.

  • Background in scaling organizations from web-only to cross-platform development.

  • Demonstrated ability to set a holistic product vision while executing iteratively.

  • Experience partnering with engineering and design to establish foundational mobile infrastructure and design patterns.

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

About the Role

As a Staff SRE & DevOps Engineer at Rula, you will be at the heart of our engineering operations, ensuring our systems are robust, efficient, and scalable. In this role, you'll collaborate closely with application engineering teams to enhance observability across our platforms and spearhead the adoption of SRE best practices. Ideal candidates will thrive on the opportunity to influence both technology and culture, making a lasting impact by embedding reliability and efficiency into the DNA of our engineering practices and practices.

Required Qualifications

  • 8+ years of experience with Site Reliability Engineering and/or DevOps, with a proven ability to work independently on projects and tasks.

  • Experience collaborating across engineering and product teams, to drive change.

  • Strong Site Reliability / DevOps Experience – knowledge of how to work with and properly apply SRE fundamentals in a mission-critical environment.

  • Experience with on-call rotations in mission-critical environments to ensure Service Level Objectives are met for internal and external customers.

  • 5+ years of Kubernetes experience.

  • 5+ years of AWS experience.

  • Experience with all aspects of Site Reliability, including monitoring, alerting, metrics, logging, and application performance monitoring, which make up the core job responsibilities.

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Well-seasoned and proficient knowledge of handling complex incidents properly according to best practices.

  • Collaborative working style and thrives in a remote environment.

  • High personal awareness, growth mindset; “know what they don’t know” during incidents, and while participating in complex problems.

  • 1+ year of Harness Experience.

  • Previous experience in mission-critical systems and enterprises. SRE requires a commitment to excellence, with a deep ingrained culture of performing at a high level in stressful situations.

As a Staff SRE & DevOps Engineer at Rula, you will be at the heart of our engineering operations, ensuring our systems are robust, efficient, and scalable. In this role, you'll collaborate closely with application engineering teams to enhance observability across our platforms and spearhead the adoption of SRE best practices. Ideal candidates will thrive on the opportunity to influence both technology and culture, making a lasting impact by embedding reliability and efficiency into the DNA of our engineering practices and practices.

Required Qualifications

 - 8+ years of experience with Site Reliability Engineering and/or DevOps, with a proven ability to work independently on projects and tasks.

 - Experience collaborating across engineering and product teams, to drive change.

 - Strong Site Reliability / DevOps Experience – knowledge of how to work with and properly apply SRE fundamentals in a mission-critical environment.

 - Experience with on-call rotations in mission-critical environments to ensure Service Level Objectives are met for internal and external customers.

 - 5+ years of Kubernetes experience.

 - 5+ years of AWS experience.

 - Experience with all aspects of Site Reliability, including monitoring, alerting, metrics, logging, and application performance monitoring, which make up the core job responsibilities.

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

 - Well-seasoned and proficient knowledge of handling complex incidents properly according to best practices.

 - Collaborative working style and thrives in a remote environment.

 - High personal awareness, growth mindset; “know what they don’t know” during incidents, and while participating in complex problems.

 - 1+ year of Harness Experience.

 - Previous experience in mission-critical systems and enterprises. SRE requires a commitment to excellence, with a deep ingrained culture of performing at a high level in stressful situations.

jobs.title: Sr. Mobile Engineer - AI (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re shaping the future of mental health care with AI-enabled experiences that enhance, not replace, the human connection at the core of therapy. Our north star is clinically-grounded and responsible AI designed to bring greater transparency, personalization, and continuous support across the therapy journey. Our work transforms therapy into an experience that’s more connected and accessible. As we expand our portfolio of AI experiences, we’re scaling our team to drive innovation and set a new standard for mental health care.

We are hiring a Senior Mobile Engineer to help build Rula’s first iOS and Android apps. You’ll work closely with a Staff Mobile Engineer, product managers, and designers to deliver impactful patient-facing features from day one. As a founding engineer, you’ll contribute to a brand-new codebase, shape our engineering practices, and play a critical role in making mental health care more accessible on mobile. This is a unique opportunity to combine deep coding with real product impact.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years software engineering experience, including 2+ years professional mobile development

  • 2+ years of experience with React Native

  • Experience shipping production mobile features on iOS and/or Android

  • Strong debugging, testing, and code quality discipline

  • Demonstrated ability to collaborate cross-functionally

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Familiarity with native iOS (Swift/Objective-C) or Android (Kotlin/Java) modules

  • Experience working on 0→1 mobile products

  • Contributions to shared mobile infra (CI/CD, component library, analytics) are a plus

jobs.descriptionHtml:

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being.

About the Role

We are seeking a Sr. Performance Marketing Manager with deep expertise in the Google suite of advertising products to join our team and lead our core SEM channel along with emerging pMAX and Youtube channels. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving new patient starts growth across our comprehensive patient care solution spanning therapy and psychiatry. This role will set channel strategy and collaborate with cross-functional partners and manage a contractor to see strategy through to execution. We are looking for a data-driven, self-starter who is deeply committed to Rula's mission and values.

Required Qualifications

  • 7+ years of marketing experience with 3+ years of search marketing experience

  • Hands-on-keyboard experience managing SEM, pMAX and Youtube programs

  • Experience managing complex accounts, with annual budgets spanning $XX M 

  • Demonstrated business impact, either through launching and scaling a new product / service or driving significant efficiency improvements

  • Ability to analyze data from disparate systems to identify and communicate trends, i.e. ad platforms, site analytics tools, BI tools and CRMs

  • Capability to work cross-functionally with Product, Analytics, Biz Ops and Finance to drive program strategy through to execution

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • 2+ years experience at a high-growth start-up 

  • Experience working in regulated industries, particularly in the health or mental health space

  • Experience in marketplace businesses

  • Rounded skillset beyond media buying inclusive of measurement, martech enablement and planning and forecasting experience

  • Experience working with fully in-house or lean hybrid teams

jobs.title: Financial Operations Insights Manager (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

At Rula, our Financial Operations team plays a key role in making sure providers can focus on care while we keep the business running smoothly. As our Insights Manager, you’ll turn data into insights that shape how we grow - from helping us understand provider enrollment trends to uncovering opportunities in billing and collections. You’ll sit at the center of Finance and Operations, working closely with leaders across the company to answer important questions and build tools that make everyone’s work easier. If you enjoy building clarity out of complexity and want your work to directly influence how thousands of patients get connected to care, this role will be especially rewarding.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years in a dedicated analytics role w/ end to end ownership of analytic outputs & insights

  • Expert level in Google Sheets or Excel with advanced skills in data cleaning, merging, analysis, and modeling across multiple sources (e.g., Salesforce, Airtable, Redshift, EHR)

  • Expert level SQL including interacting with data warehouses (Fivetran / Redshift / BigQuery)

  • Experience creating data visualization and modeling with heightened analytical rigor

  • Experience with at least one BI tool (Looker / Tableau / PowerBI)

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Experience with programming languages (Python, R) for data analysis and automation

  • Experience building scalable processes and leveraging enterprise systems (e.g., Salesforce) to improve efficiency

  • Advanced data visualization and data storytelling

  • Experience collaborating in an IDE with SQL & Python workflows

  • Demonstrated ability to design and implement automation to reduce manual reporting or operational effort

  • Familiarity with financial or payments datasets (e.g., billing, collections, accounts receivable)

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

We’re seeking a Sr. Product Designer to join our AI-supported therapy team, where we’re reimagining how mental health care can be delivered through thoughtful product design and intelligent AI support. This role will focus heavily on native mobile experiences (iOS and Android) while collaborating on cross-platform design solutions.

You’ll be responsible for creating user-centered workflows that make therapy more accessible, engaging, and effective. Ideal candidates are excited by the opportunity to combine strong mobile design expertise with emerging AI-powered features—building products that empower therapists and support patients on their mental health journey.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of professional experience in Product Design with a strong portfolio demonstrating shipped products.

  • Proven experience designing native mobile applications (iOS + Android), with a track record of launching high-quality mobile-first products

  • Experience collaborating cross-functionally with product, engineering, and (ideally) AI/ML partners.

  • Mastery of Figma for end-to-end product design, prototyping, and design system contribution.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to clearly articulate design decisions and tradeoffs.

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Exposure to designing experiences that incorporate AI or machine learning (e.g., personalization, intelligent assistance).

  • Experience designing interfaces for high-trust domains

  • Experience conducting and integrating user research into the design process.

  • Experience with cross-platform design systems (building or contributing to design systems that span iOS, Android, and web) — helps ensure scalability and consistency across Rula’s ecosystem.

  • Familiarity with accessibility standards for mobile (WCAG, iOS Accessibility APIs, Android Accessibility Suite) — ensures our AI-supported therapy products are inclusive for all users.

  • Experience with motion design and micro-interactions for mobile (e.g., animations, transitions, haptic feedback) — ability to elevate usability and delight in AI-supported mobile experiences.

We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re shaping the future of mental health care with AI-enabled experiences that enhance, not replace, the human connection at the core of therapy. Our north star is clinically-grounded and responsible AI designed to bring greater transparency, personalization, and continuous support across the therapy journey. Our work transforms therapy into an experience that’s more connected and accessible. As we expand our portfolio of AI experiences, we’re scaling our team to drive innovation and set a new standard for mental health care.

We’re seeking a Sr. Product Designer to join our AI-supported therapy team, where we’re reimagining how mental health care can be delivered through thoughtful product design and intelligent AI support. This role will focus heavily on native mobile experiences (iOS and Android) while collaborating on cross-platform design solutions.

You’ll be responsible for creating user-centered workflows that make therapy more accessible, engaging, and effective. Ideal candidates are excited by the opportunity to combine strong mobile design expertise with emerging AI-powered features—building products that empower therapists and support patients on their mental health journey.

Required Qualifications

 - 5+ years of professional experience in Product Design with a strong portfolio demonstrating shipped products.

 - Proven experience designing native mobile applications (iOS + Android), with a track record of launching high-quality mobile-first products

 - Experience collaborating cross-functionally with product, engineering, and (ideally) AI/ML partners.

 - Mastery of Figma for end-to-end product design, prototyping, and design system contribution.

 - Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to clearly articulate design decisions and tradeoffs.

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

 - Exposure to designing experiences that incorporate AI or machine learning (e.g., personalization, intelligent assistance).

 - Experience designing interfaces for high-trust domains

 - Experience conducting and integrating user research into the design process.

 - Experience with cross-platform design systems (building or contributing to design systems that span iOS, Android, and web) — helps ensure scalability and consistency across Rula’s ecosystem.

 - Familiarity with accessibility standards for mobile (WCAG, iOS Accessibility APIs, Android Accessibility Suite) — ensures our AI-supported therapy products are inclusive for all users.

 - Experience with motion design and micro-interactions for mobile (e.g., animations, transitions, haptic feedback) — ability to elevate usability and delight in AI-supported mobile experiences.

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

 - 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

 - Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

 - Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

 - 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

 - Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

 - Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

 - Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

 - New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

 - Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

 - Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

 - Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.
