jobs.title: Staff AI Data Engineer (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re shaping the future of mental health care with AI-enabled experiences that enhance, not replace, the human connection at the core of therapy. Our north star is clinically-grounded and responsible AI designed to bring greater transparency, personalization, and continuous support across the therapy journey. Our work transforms therapy into an experience that’s more connected and accessible. As we expand our portfolio of AI experiences, we’re scaling our team to drive innovation and set a new standard for mental health care.

As a Data Engineer, you will help build and maintain the data pipelines that pull information from our central storage system to train machine learning models and AI tools, supporting a variety of use cases that support our providers and improve patient outcomes. You will be part of a collaborative group that values open discussions and quick adjustments to meet changing needs, working alongside data experts and other specialists to turn raw information into useful resources for our mission. This role sits within our data team, which is part of the overall engineering organization and is a close partner team to our ML Team, where your daily work—designing reliable flows of information, testing for accuracy, and solving unexpected challenges—will directly support innovations that help more individuals get the mental health support they deserve. If you enjoy turning complex data into something that makes a real difference in people's lives, this is your chance to contribute to meaningful advancements in health care.

Required Qualifications

  • 8+ years of Data Pipeline Development – specifically building and maintaining scalable ETL/ELT pipelines for ML/AI training workflows, using tools like AWS Glue, DBT, Dagster, Spark, or Ray for distributed processing of large-scale structured and unstructured data from Data Lakes. Strong proficiency in Spark, Python, and SQL for feature engineering, data transformation, and ensuring high-quality, versioned datasets suitable for model training and inference.

  • 8+ years of Cloud Infrastructure & Data Warehousing experience, 4+ of which with a focus in AWS. This person should be proficient in AWS services such as Redshift, S3, Glue, IAM, EMR, and SageMaker for supporting ML/AI pipelines. Candidates may bring additional experience from other cloud environments (e.g., GCP services like BigQuery, GCS, Dataflow, or AI Platform; Azure services like Synapse Analytics, Blob Storage, Databricks, or Machine Learning Studio) to complement their AWS expertise. Experience optimizing data warehouses (e.g., Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery) and managing data lakes (e.g., S3, GCS, Azure Blob) for large-scale, versioned ML training datasets, with a focus on partitioning, access controls, and integration with distributed processing frameworks like Spark.

  • Implementing scalable data validation, quality checks, and error-handling mechanisms tailored for ML/AI pipelines, including bias detection, anomaly identification, and dataset integrity to ensure high-fidelity training data. Familiarity with data governance practices, such as metadata management, lineage tracking for reproducible models, and compliance with regulations like CPRA or HIPAA in Data Lake environments.

  • Optimizing data pipelines, queries, and managing large datasets for efficiency and scalability. Knowledge of best practices for high-throughput systems.

  • Experience with data security measures (encryption, role-based access control, data masking). Understanding of compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, SOC 2) and their application in data engineering.

  • Strong ability to work cross-functionally with data analysts, data scientists, and stakeholders. Effective communication skills to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences. Adaptability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment.

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Hands-on experience with AWS tools like S3, Glue, EMR, SageMaker, and Lambda for building scalable ETL/ELT pipelines optimized for ML/LLM training, including feature engineering, data versioning, and handling large-scale unstructured data

  • Proven track record in implementing robust data validation, bias detection, and lineage tracking in Data Lakes, with familiarity in compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA for health data) and tools like Delta Lake or Iceberg to ensure high-fidelity, reproducible datasets for model training.

  • Familiarity with infrastructure as code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation for managing cloud resources.

  • Experience implementing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for data workflows.

  • Experience in monitoring and reducing costs for large-scale ML/AI workflows in AWS, using techniques like spot instances for training jobs, auto-scaling EMR clusters, and efficient S3 storage tiers (e.g., Intelligent-Tiering) to minimize expenses while maintaining performance.

  • Strong ability to partner with data scientists and ML engineers to design efficient pipelines, using orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Dagster) for incremental loading and cost optimization, while monitoring performance metrics like latency and resource utilization in AWS environments.

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Head of FP&A (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re hiring a Head of FP&A to lead forecasting, budgeting, and strategic financial planning at a fast-growing, mission-driven company. This role will partner closely with the CFO, VP Finance, department leaders, and the executive team to enhance decision making throughout the company with the Finance and shareholder lens. You’ll own the company’s financial model, build scalable planning processes, and help drive resource allocation decisions that support growth and margin improvement. You will also lead the team partnering with critical decision makers at the company to ensure critical company priorities are executed in the most efficient manner.

The ideal candidate combines financial rigor with strong entrepreneurial instincts and thrives in fast-paced, high-change environments. Prior experience in investment banking, private equity, strategic finance, or a high-performance FP&A team is strongly preferred. This role requires the ability to juggle high-level strategic thinking with attention to detail, executive communication, and a proactive, collaborative mindset.

Required Qualifications

  • 12+ years of related professional experience in Financial Planning & Analysis, Corporate Finance, or related roles

  • 5+ years of people management experience with a team size of 3+ team members

  • 3+ years experience at a high-growth start-up

  • Strong command of financial modeling, forecasting, and budgeting processes, with the ability to translate data into clear, actionable insights

  • Track record of growing responsibilities / scope and driving meaningful business impact through financial analysis and cross-functional collaboration

  • Ability to drive cross-functional planning and budgetary alignment

  • Ownership of both revenue and cost drivers

  • Proven experience with full P&L ownership, including accountability for both top-line growth and bottom-line performance

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Demonstrated success leading multi-level finance organizations

  • Proven track record designing and implementing new financial processes, systems, and tools that improve forecasting accuracy, efficiency, and decision support

  • Experience in marketplace business models, with a strong grasp of revenue drivers, customer acquisition economics, and unit-level profitability

  • Strong strategic and business acumen

  • MBA or advanced degree in Finance, Economics, or a related discipline preferred

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Revenue Cycle Manager (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

Rula is seeking an experienced revenue cycle professional to join our growing team. Reporting directly to the Sr. Financial Operations Manager, the Revenue Cycle Manager will be responsible for researching payer requirements, EHR payer configuration, creating robust training materials, and driving operational efficiency as we extend our reach and make mental healthcare work for everyone.

This role requires a strong understanding of core revenue cycle management operations - verification of benefits, claim submission, adjudication, and collection. In addition to RCM experience, the ideal candidate will carry a high attention to detail and possess strong communication, organizational, and analytical skills.

The healthcare industry is constantly changing - if you enjoy problem-solving and working collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply!

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of diverse revenue cycle management experience - e.g. verification of benefits, Insurance AR, and/or payment posting

  • 3+ years of experience in revenue cycle management and/or strategy consulting, leading end-to-end transformation (process, technology, and people)

  • Proven ability to design and scale processes, leveraging tools such as CRMs, EHRs (e.g. AMD), payer portals (e.g., Availity), and Google Suite/Microsoft Office, etc. to drive optimization

  • Expertise in applying structure, prioritization, and effective communication across the organization to solve complex problems and predict future needs

  • Familiarity with writing deliverables (e.g. technical requirements, experiment results, strategy documents) that are concise and clear for technical and non-technical audiences

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Experience in startup and/or fast-paced environment

  • General knowledge of payer / insurance landscape, particularly reviewing and implementing requirements for healthcare payer contracts

  • Familiarity with diverse insurance billing types (commercial, EAP, Medicare / Medicaid, etc)

  • General knowledge of EDI (e.g. 837 professional transactions), ERA enrollments, and clearinghouse processes

  • Technical savviness and fluency with Salesforce, Zendesk, and/or similar platforms

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

 - Familiarity with writing deliverables (e.g. technical requirements, experiment results, strategy documents) that are concise and clear for technical and non-technical audiences

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

 - Experience in startup and/or fast-paced environment

 - General knowledge of payer / insurance landscape, particularly reviewing and implementing requirements for healthcare payer contracts

 - Familiarity with diverse insurance billing types (commercial, EAP, Medicare / Medicaid, etc)

 - General knowledge of EDI (e.g. 837 professional transactions), ERA enrollments, and clearinghouse processes

 - Technical savviness and fluency with Salesforce, Zendesk, and/or similar platforms

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

 - 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

 - Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

 - Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

 - 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

 - Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

 - Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

 - Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

 - New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

 - Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

 - Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

 - Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Provider Experience (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

In the Provider Experience team, our mission is to simplify life for Rula’s providers (therapists). We develop tools and experiences that alleviate their administrative burdens, allowing them to concentrate on delivering high-quality care. Our projects include creating intuitive user experiences to boost productivity, developing backend services for securely storing highly-compliant PHI data, and implementing complex workflow automations to support our clinical operations. We’re seeking a passionate, mission-driven, senior engineer who can work across our entire stack. If you thrive in a collaborative environment with high ownership, pursue technical excellence, and make solution-oriented decisions, the Provider Experience team is the perfect fit for you.

Required Qualifications

  • 4+ years of related professional experience in software engineering building modern web applications.

  • 2+ years of Production experience with React & Typescript.

  • Experience leading large projects: designing, planning, estimating, work breakdown, collaboration with multiple engineers, releasing.

  • Ability to operate full-stack.

  • Passion for engineering quality.

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Computer Science degree or equivalent experience.

  • Healthcare (or other regulated industry) experience.

  • Strong collaboration & communication skills.

  • Strong sense of end-to-end user-centric engineering.

  • Previous experience / passion for mentoring other engineers.

jobs.title: Sr. Engineering Manager (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We're hiring a Senior Engineering Manager, Platform Engineering to lead our efforts in building world-class reliability, cloud infrastructure, and operational excellence at Rula. In this role, you'll own the strategy, frameworks, pipelines, and tooling that ensure our production and non-production systems maintain high availability — from monitoring and observability platforms to incident response systems.

You'll partner closely with the Platform Services team to co-own the developer experience by defining the standards, practices, and architecture to ensure our application developers can deliver services that are secure, scalable, and reliable across all environments while creating a smooth and easy path to develop these services and applications.

This is a highly cross-functional leadership role, working with product engineering, data engineering, and security teams, along with other stakeholders across the company. You'll directly impact service reliability, minimize customer-facing incidents, and shape the operational environments (production and non-production) where Rula services run with stability, efficiency, and resilience. If you're passionate about distributed systems, operational excellence, and creating bulletproof production environments, we'd love to hear from you.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of people management experience, leading engineering teams - ideally building out the initial team and then growing to 5-7 engineers, is perfect type/size

  • 3+ years leading SRE, Platform, or Infrastructure teams with direct ownership of CI/CD pipelines, development environments and/or internal tooling

  • 5+ years working with cloud providers

  • Different work environments: Growth company experience & Working cross-functionally in an expanding Engineering organization

  • Demonstrated success in building and scaling cloud-native infrastructure and frameworks in modern cloud environments (AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform

  • Demonstrated experience directly managing projects with a variety of stakeholders (define and build plan, manage activities, risks, stakeholder communication, etc)

  • Experience defining and tracking SRE KPIs

Preferred Qualifications

  • Healthcare experience

  • Cloud Cost Mgmt / FinOps

  • Familiar with the DevOps culture and practices associated

  • Responsible for cloud architecture and environment management

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

Our team

jobs.title: Patient Programs Specialist (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

Rula is seeking a licensed mental health professional to fill an open role as a Patient Programs Specialist reporting into our Clinical team. The Patient Programs Specialist is a subject matter resource for providers, patients, and internal teams, supporting the management of complex and high-risk clinical situations. The Specialist actively resolves questions, investigates clinical risk situations and adverse events, addresses clinical grievances, and ensures providers and patients receive the necessary support and guidance. This role leverages strong clinical knowledge to promote patient safety, regulatory compliance, and best practices in care delivery. Success in this position requires problem-solving skills, adaptability, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. This is an excellent opportunity for a clinician passionate about making an impact in challenging, rapidly evolving clinical settings. This role does not require any direct clinical care but will interact daily with providers and patients by video, phone, or email. In the future, this role may participate in on-call crisis response during business hours.

Required Qualifications

  • Master’s degree and an active, unencumbered clinical license in any state (LCSW, LMFT, LPC, or equivalent)

  • 5 years of post-master’s licensed clinical experience across diverse populations, including high-acuity and crisis situations, to ensure the seasoned clinical judgment, credibility with peers, and real-world crisis management expertise needed to guide providers and resolve high-stakes patient safety and clinically complex cases.

  • Demonstrated expertise in patient safety, crisis intervention, and clinical risk management, with proven ability to navigate urgent and high-risk situations.

  • Strong investigative and documentation skills, with ability to communicate findings clearly and compassionately.

  • Proven experience collaborating across departments and coaching or advising providers in managing clinical risk.

  • Deep commitment to patient-first care, balancing empathy and firmness in resolving sensitive and complex issues.

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Experience in telehealth, community mental health, or care coordination strongly preferred.

  • Experience in addressing patient complaints and coaching providers

  • Experience with care coordination and systems of care

  • Patient-centered and safety mindset

  • 2+ year experience in a high-growth mental health tech start-up

  • Enjoys working in fast-paced, high-stakes, and a quick response environment, including complex challenging situations, resolving problems, and finding solutions

  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and efficiently, with a strong attention to compliance and detail

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Sr. Data Scientist - AI (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re shaping the future of mental health care with AI-enabled experiences that enhance, not replace, the human connection at the core of therapy. Our north star is clinically-grounded and responsible AI designed to bring greater transparency, personalization, and continuous support across the therapy journey. Our work transforms therapy into an experience that’s more connected and accessible. As we expand our portfolio of AI experiences, we’re scaling our team to drive innovation and set a new standard for mental health care.

We're hiring our first AI Data Scientist! At Rula, you will get to work with unique, proprietary language-based clinical data to identify key insights and build tailored experiences for patients and providers. This person will be a strategic thought partner to Product Management, Engineering and Finance leadership. The Data Scientist will develop insights, provide operational support, and establish data foundations across multiple AI domains, including data labeling, synthetic data generation, evaluation writing and model training.

This is a senior IC role, requiring a skilled Data Scientist to work both at the big picture and granular levels, ensuring all decisions are data driven, and developing innovative approaches to assess progress and performance of our initiatives.

Required Qualifications

  • A Bachelor’s (or higher) degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, or related technical field with strong quantitative foundation

  • 7+ years of product data science experience; with focus to natural language processing (NLP) on large, unstructured data sets

  • Advanced technical proficiency with modern data stacks (i.e. dbt, Airflow, etc.) and data visualization tools (i.e. Looker, Tableau, Hex, etc.)

  • Deep understanding of product analytics and metrics, with experience translating them into actionable insights for business partners

  • Expertise with data modeling and machine learning techniques

  • Strong experience working directly with A/B testing and statistical analysis

  • Experience with labeling data for model consumption

  • Experience with synthetic data generation

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Experience in product analytics role in the digital space

  • A proven ability to connect analytics insights to business strategy, influencing decisions that drive revenue and growth

  • Proficiency with Python/R for analytics/scripting

  • Expertise with large language models (LLM) and labeling

  • Experience in data science working with clinical data

Our north star is clinically-grounded and responsible AI designed to bring greater transparency, personalization, and continuous support across the therapy journey. Our work transforms therapy into an experience that’s more connected and accessible. As we expand our portfolio of AI experiences, we’re scaling our team to drive innovation and set a new standard for mental health care.

We're hiring our first AI Data Scientist! At Rula, you will get to work with unique, proprietary language-based clinical data to identify key insights and build tailored experiences for patients and providers. This person will be a strategic thought partner to Product Management, Engineering and Finance leadership. The Data Scientist will develop insights, provide operational support, and establish data foundations across multiple AI domains, including data labeling, synthetic data generation, evaluation writing and model training.

This is a senior IC role, requiring a skilled Data Scientist to work both at the big picture and granular levels, ensuring all decisions are data driven, and developing innovative approaches to assess progress and performance of our initiatives.

Required Qualifications

 - A Bachelor’s (or higher) degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, or related technical field with strong quantitative foundation

 - 7+ years of product data science experience; with focus to natural language processing (NLP) on large, unstructured data sets

 - Advanced technical proficiency with modern data stacks (i.e. dbt, Airflow, etc.) and data visualization tools (i.e. Looker, Tableau, Hex, etc.)

 - Deep understanding of product analytics and metrics, with experience translating them into actionable insights for business partners

 - Expertise with data modeling and machine learning techniques

 - Strong experience working directly with A/B testing and statistical analysis

 - Experience with labeling data for model consumption

 - Experience with synthetic data generation

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

 - Experience in product analytics role in the digital space

 - A proven ability to connect analytics insights to business strategy, influencing decisions that drive revenue and growth

 - Proficiency with Python/R for analytics/scripting

 - Expertise with large language models (LLM) and labeling

 - Experience in data science working with clinical data

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

 - 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

 - Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

 - Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

 - 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

 - Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

 - Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

 - Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

 - New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

 - Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

 - Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

 - Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Data Annotation Manager (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re shaping the future of mental health care with AI-enabled experiences that enhance, not replace, the human connection at the core of therapy. Our north star is clinically-grounded and responsible AI designed to bring greater transparency, personalization, and continuous support across the therapy journey. Our work transforms therapy into an experience that’s more connected and accessible. As we expand our portfolio of AI experiences, we’re scaling our team to drive innovation and set a new standard for mental health care.

We’re hiring our first Data Annotation Manager, a trailblazing role at the intersection of healthcare and AI. This is your chance to build, scale, and shape a data annotation program from the ground up, laying the foundation for how we deliver care for years to come.

Clinical data annotation is the fuel that powers our AI models, and in this role, you’ll design the systems, teams, and processes that make it possible. You’ll work with and lead both internal and external partners to create scalable, high-quality annotation pipelines that directly impact how thousands of patients experience care.

This is an opportunity to define a new function and ensure every piece of data serves the purpose of delivering more human centered care for our patients.

Required Qualifications

  • 3+ years of related professional experience, leading data annotation or labeling operations in a fast-paced environment.

  • Evidence of having built top-tier data annotation processes from scratch in a scaling environment, with experience delivering high-quality data that integrates into engineering, data science, and product teams

  • 2+ years of experience hiring, leading, and managing internal or external data annotation teams

  • Experience defining data annotation processes, including standard operating procedures (SOPs), audit mechanisms, and workflows that enable distributed teams to work at scale

  • Proven success in building and launching data annotation processes from scratch. Knowledge of quality scoring frameworks, inter-rater reliability, and QA loop design

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Psychology training (e.g., Masters or PhD training) demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of psychological concepts

  • Familiarity with clinical data, especially EHR and text-based datasets. Multi-modal (e.g., audio, video, or images) experience a plus.

  • Familiarity with machine learning workflows, including how annotated data is used in model training.

  • Experience managing highly skilled clinical or PhD-level annotators

  • Proficiency with common analytics tools and the ability to self-serve analytics needs (e.g., Hex and SQL)

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Backend/AI (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe that mental health is just as important as physical health. We recognize that mental health issues can be complex and multifaceted, and we are dedicated to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms.

We aim to create a world where mental health is no longer stigmatized or marginalized, but rather is embraced as an integral part of one's overall well-being. 

We believe that by providing quality care that is both evidence-based and compassionate, we can empower individuals to take charge of their mental health and achieve their full potential. We are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of those struggling with mental health issues and we strive to be a force for positive change in the field of mental healthcare.

About the Role

We’re shaping the future of mental health care with AI-enabled experiences that enhance, not replace, the human connection at the core of therapy. Our north star is clinically-grounded and responsible AI designed to bring greater transparency, personalization, and continuous support across the therapy journey. Our work transforms therapy into an experience that’s more connected and accessible. As we expand our portfolio of AI experiences, we’re scaling our team to drive innovation and set a new standard for mental health care.

We’re seeking a Senior Software Engineer to take a leading role in shaping the backend for Rula’s next generation of products. You’ll design and deliver scalable systems in TypeScript and Node.js that power new mobile and patient-facing experiences, including AI-driven capabilities that help match patients with the right care and improve outcomes. As a senior member of the team, you’ll collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and mobile engineers, mentor junior teammates, and influence how we scale our technology. This is a chance to combine technical leadership with mission-driven work, helping make mental health care more accessible and effective.

Required Qualifications

  • 6-8+ years of backend software engineering experience, including designing, building, and operating production systems at scale

  • Strong proficiency in at least one backend language commonly used for mobile backends (e.g., Python, Node.js, Ruby)

  • Experience designing and implementing APIs (REST and/or GraphQL) to support mobile applications

  • Hands-on experience with prompt engineering — designing, testing, and refining prompts to improve model outputs and system performance.

  • Hands-on experience integrating with large language models (via OpenAI, Anthropic, Amazon Bedrock, or custom-hosted models)

  • Strong knowledge of distributed systems fundamentals (scalability, caching, performance optimization, reliability, observability)

Preferred Qualifications

While having the preferred qualifications enhances your candidacy, having all of them is not mandatory. We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even those who may not meet every preferred requirement.

  • Degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.

  • Familiarity with data-intensive systems or workflows (pipelines, integrations, metrics capture).

  • Experience with modern infrastructure and tooling (CI/CD, cloud platforms, observability).

  • Comfortable participating in on-call rotations, troubleshooting production issues, and contributing to team reliability practices.

  • Prior experience in a high-growth or evolving environment, with the ability to adapt to shifting priorities.

We're serious about your well-being! As part of our team, full-time employees receive:

  • 100% remote work environment (US-based only): Working hours to support a healthy work-life balance, ensuring you can meet both professional and personal commitments

  • Attractive pay and benefits: Full transparency of pay ranges regardless of where you live in the United States

  • Comprehensive health benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and FSA/HSA

  • 401(k) plan access: Start saving for your future

  • Generous time-off policies: Including 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year for self-care (for most employees)

  • Paid parental leave: Available for all parents, including birthing, non-birthing, adopting, and fostering

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Support for your mental and physical health

  • New hire home office stipend: Set up your workspace for success

  • Quarterly department stipend: Fund team-building activities or in-person gatherings

  • Wellness events and lunch & learns: Explore a variety of engaging topics

  • Community and employee resource groups: Participate in groups that celebrate employee identity and lived experiences, fostering a sense of community and belonging for all

Our team

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our mission of making mental healthcare work for everyone.  We are dedicated to having a culture of inclusion that will support our employees in feeling safe, seen, heard, and valued.
